definition: to take care of/to show consideration/to attend to/to look after
according to/in accordance with/to shine/to illuminate/to reflect/to look at (one's reflection)/to take (a photo)/photo/as requested/as before
variant of 照[zhao4]/to shine/to illuminate
surname Gu
to look after/to take into consideration/to attend to
to ask sb to carefully consider a request (idiom)
(of a person) left unattended/not cared for

sentences.english: She was rejected by her father and his second wife. Zora was forced to take care of herself.
sentences.chinese: 她父亲和继母不养她，卓拉被迫自己照顾自己。

sentences.english: Because ofu, I know the distance is just a number for us!
sentences.chinese: 答应你，我会为了你在西雅图好好照顾自己。

sentences.english: " Gentling " means training it to except accept the human attention need it needed for care and gloomygrooming.
sentences.chinese: “驯化”意味着训练他们接受人类必要的照顾与护理。

sentences.english: We will take good care and properly protect the patients vulnerable.
sentences.chinese: 并且对于易受伤害患者予以优先照顾和妥善保护。

sentences.english: However, Group B patients enjoyed conventional care instead of special care.
sentences.chinese: 乙组按常规护理，不对照顾者进行特殊施教。

sentences.english: They should also be constantly concerned in taking care and cleaning their stoma .
sentences.chinese: 他们还应该不断关注，在照顾和清洁他们的气孔。

sentences.english: Expensive into mom to take care of small into also very tired, she fell asleep sitting there.
sentences.chinese: 贵成妈为照顾小成也很累，她坐在那里就睡着了。

sentences.english: How to look after your e-dog ?
The old lady fusses over her little dog as if it were a sick child.
sentences.chinese: 老妇人照顾她的小狗，犹如照顾她生病的孩子。

sentences.english: The old lady fusses over her little dog as if it were a sick child.
sentences.chinese: 老妇人照顾她的小狗，犹如照顾她生病的孩子。

sentences.english: Life teachers in our school take charge of students' daily life.
sentences.chinese: 学校配有生活老师，照顾学生的饮食起居。

sentences.english: "I was at home taking care of the kids, " she says.
sentences.chinese: “那会儿我正在家里照顾小家伙们”，她说。

sentences.english: My elder sister, take care of yourself and master the direction of your eudemonia .
sentences.chinese: 师姐，你要把握好幸福的方向，照顾好自己。

sentences.english: He charged me to take good care of his children while he was away.
sentences.chinese: 他外出时托付我好生照顾他的孩子。

sentences.english: Um, Marv, can we look after Sizzles?.
sentences.chinese: 马维，可以让我们照顾西索吗？

definition: to tend/to take care of sb
to look after/to attend to/to have in care
in every possible way (idiom); meticulous
to love dearly
to attend to the needs of (an invalid, disabled person etc)/caregiver
to serve/to wait upon
to nurse/to look after/to watch over/(old) hospital nurse
to fall ill
to show concern and care for
to bless/to cherish/to take good care of/to conserve
considerate (of other people's needs)
to show every possible consideration (idiom); meticulous care
to take care/to keep an eye on/to look after/to tell/to remind
to foster/to bring up/to raise
to empathize/to allow (for sth)/to show understanding/to appreciate
to visit/to pay a call to
